data.name: Ordinal number check
data.description:
# Description : 

Given a string as input, check if it is a valid ordinal number in English or not. If it is valid return true otherwise return fasle.

For users who want to know about *ordinal numbers* go here :

[Ordinal number](https://www.mathsisfun.com/numbers/cardinal-ordinal-chart.html)

# Possible inputs :

    21st ---> true
    12nd ---> false
    1nd ---> false


This is  **code golf** so there are limits :

JavaScript solution is limited to less than 56 characters.

# Examples :


<!-- language: lang-js -->

    O('12th')                                           --->  true
    O('1st')                                            --->  true
    O('21nd')                                           --->  false
    O('11st')                                           --->  false
    O('111199231923819238198231923213123909808th')      --->  true

<!-- end snippet -->
All inputs will always be valid. i.e they will be in the form of string and consist of a digit (or number of digits) along with one of the four suffixes :

`st` , `nd` , `rd` , `th`
